summary: A "modular open systems approach" allows DOD to easily add or replace weapon parts over time—similar to plug-and-play computer parts. Deciding on this kind of approach early helps DOD save time and money on upgrades and maintenance later. DOD often cited short-term costs as a hurdle to this approach. But it didn't analyze whether those costs outweighed potential long-term benefits like faster upgrades. Also, DOD...
title: Weapon Systems Acquisition: DOD Needs Better Planning to Attain Benefits of Modular Open Systems
